meanings.definition: The outer covering or finish of a garment, especially at the collar, cuffs, or lapels.
meanings.sent1: The jacket's facings added a nice touch to its overall look.
meanings.sent2: She sewed the facings onto the edges of the dress to give it a polished appearance.
meanings.sent3: The facings on the coat decided to have a fashion show of their own.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the facings of a well-tailored suit, framing her face beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The facings on the shirt were like the icing on a cake, completing the outfit perfectly.

meanings.definition: The process of turning a building or room in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The facings of the house towards the sunset provided a stunning view.
meanings.sent2: During the renovation, they discussed changing the facings of the building to face the park.
meanings.sent3: The facings of the room decided to have a dance party and spin around.
meanings.sent4: His decision to change the facings of his life led to new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The facings of the building turned towards the rising sun, welcoming a new day.

meanings.definition: The action of confronting or opposing someone or something.

meanings.sent2: She bravely stood her ground, ready to face the facings of her fears.
meanings.sent3: The facings of the argument suddenly turned into a friendly debate.
meanings.sent4: In the facings of adversity, he found strength he never knew he had.
meanings.sent5: The facings of the challenge ahead seemed daunting, but she was determined to overcome them.
